newsitem.title: PORTUGAL: Share trade BFE, BPI suspended.
newsitem.headline: Share trade BFE, BPI suspended.

text.p: Share trade in Banco de Fomento & Exterior SA and Banco Portugues de Investimento SA has been suspended, dealers said on Friday, quoting from a bourse announcement.
The Lisbon bourse had only just announced the return of BFE after a 24-hour suspension.
Bourse officials could not be immediately contacted to comment.
Dealers said the suspension of the two shares had been ordered by the Financial Markets Committee (CMVM).
The suspensions followed an announcement by the government on Thursday that BPI was the only candidate left to take over BFE at its privatisation.
But no price has yet been given for the sale.
BFE was suspended on Thursday at 2,545 escudos per share and dealers had expected it to open down at 2,300-2,400 escudos on Friday. BPI closed at 2,115 escudos on Thursday.
A Lisbon bourse spokesman confirmed the suspension saying it had been ordered by the CMVM.
